# very strong Aáµ M [complement](complement.html) dialectic

# breaking forced associations
in times when syllabic signs and the letters of the alphabet where not abstract but defined through their ( [rebus](rebus.html) ) root, naturally all words using those signs became strongly associated. This was sometimes alleviated through [complement](complement.html) orthograpyh:  

Some words especially in later times seem to be spelled out explicitly with breaking boundaries.  
Made up example:  
remind => rem + ind  

# complement vs lost etymology
It is astonishing that Egyptians didn't write carpet with ğ“ƒ€ even though the root âˆšâ²«â²â²§ matches perfectly:  
ğ“‚“ ğ“¤ ğ“…· ğ“¤ ğ“˜ ğ“‡‹ ğ“± ğ“ª â²•â²Ÿâ²©â²«â²â²§ carpet [â²©](â²©.html) [wanderword](wanderword.html)
